result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:53 AM Defendant Seth D Moretti in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Seth D Moretti.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. Attorney Wolff indicates he will be entering a NOT GUILTY PLEA BY MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT before the Trial Court. The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court and will have this matter tag along with the defendant's other matters. Bail remains as fixed.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Wolff
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Seth D Moretti
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2022)
Prior: 323 Summit Ave., Apt. 219, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-E/witness A (EXCEPTION: Victims C-E unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

1:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Seth D Moretti in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Seth D Moretti. Victim B appeared by phone with victim/witness specialist Abigail Luty who appear in court.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
Victim B presents statements.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 28th, 2022.
